verses.verse: The Ninth Plague: Darkness Then the LORD said to Moses, (Ex. 9:22) “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, darkness which may even be felt.”
So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and there was (Ps. 105:28; Rev. 16:10) thick darkness in all the land of Egypt (Ex. 3:18) three days.
They did not see one another; nor did anyone rise from his place for three days. (Ex. 8:22, 23) But all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
Then Pharaoh called to Moses and (Ex. 8:8, 25; 10:8) said, “Go, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be kept back. Let your (Ex. 10:10) little ones also go with you.”
But Moses said, “You must also give us sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.

Our (Ex. 10:9) livestock also shall go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind. For we must take some of them to serve the LORD our God, and even we do not know with what we must serve the LORD until we arrive there.”
But the LORD (Ex. 4:21; 10:1, 20; 14:4, 8) hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
Then Pharaoh said to him, (Ex. 10:11) “Get away from me! Take heed to yourself and see my face no more! For in the day you see my face you shall die!”
So Moses said, “You have spoken well. (Ex. 11:8; Heb. 11:27) I will never see your face again.”

Death of the Firstborn Announced And the LORD said to Moses, “I will bring one more plague on Pharaoh and on Egypt. (Ex. 12:31, 33, 39) Afterward he will let you go from here. (Ex. 6:1; 12:39) When he lets you go, he will surely drive you out of here altogether.
